casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Charles Robert DEATHERAGE, Defendant-Appellant. No. 12-50526

Summary Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Feb. 20, 2013. Joseph H. Gay, Jr., Assistant U.S. Attorney, U.S. Attorney’s Office, San Antonio, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Charles Robert Deatherage, Midland, TX, pro se. Before JONES, DENNIS and HAYNES, Circuit Judges. *429PER CURIAM: *

The attorney appointed to represent Charles Robert Deatherage has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967), and United States v. Flores, 632 F.3d 229 (5th Cir.2011). Deatherage has not filed a response. We have reviewed counsel’s brief and the relevant portions of the record reflected therein. We concur with counsel’s assessment that the appeal presents no nonfrivolous issue for appellate review. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
